articles.author: By CHRISTOPHER RUGABER AP Economics Writer
articles.title: Fed seems inclined to keep rates low as virus poses risks
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Federal Reserve officials were mostly optimistic about the U.S. and global economies last month, though they noted the risk posed by China’s viral outbreak and said they were ready to keep their benchmark interest rate at its…
articles.content: WASHINGTON (AP) Federal Reserve officials were mostly optimistic about the U.S. and global economies last month, though they noted the risk posed by Chinas viral outbreak and said they were ready to keep their benchmark interest rate at its current low level … [+2287 chars]

articles.title: Hawaii to get new virus tests after receiving defective kits
articles.description: HONOLULU (AP) — Hawaii is scheduled to receive updated kits from the federal government to test for a new virus after an initial shipment did not work as expected, officials said.
articles.content:
HONOLULU (AP) Hawaii is scheduled to receive updated kits from the federal government to test for a new virus after an initial shipment did not work as expected, officials said.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention sent a notice informing states in… [+2202 chars]

articles.title: Russia names exceptions from the entry ban for Chinese
articles.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia will continue to issue official, business, humanitarian and transit visas to Chinese nationals, the country's Foreign Ministry said Wednesday, clarifying the conditions of a sweeping entry ban for Chinese citizens announced the day before.
articles.content: MOSCOW (AP) Russia will continue to issue official, business, humanitarian and transit visas to Chinese nationals, the country's Foreign Ministry said Wednesday, clarifying the conditions of a sweeping entry ban for Chinese citizens announced the day before.… [+1797 chars]

articles.author: AMIR VAHDAT Associated Press
articles.title: Iran reports its first 2 cases of the new coronavirus
articles.description: TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — Iranian authorities confirmed on Wednesday two cases of the new coronavirus, the first in the country, the semi-official ISNA news agency reported.
articles.content:
TEHRAN, Iran (AP) Iranian authorities confirmed on Wednesday two cases of the new coronavirus, the first in the country, the semi-official ISNA news agency reported.
The report did not elaborate on the nationality of the two people infected by the virus. ISN… [+1221 chars]

articles.author: By STEPHEN WADE AP Sports Writer
articles.title: Virologist: Olympics could not be held now; hopeful for July
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — A respected Japanese virologist on Wednesday said if the Tokyo Olympics were tomorrow, the games probably couldn't be held because of the fast-spreading coronavirus from Wuhan, China.

articles.author: By The Associated Press
articles.title: New virus has infected more than 75,000 people globally
articles.description: A viral outbreak that began in China has infectedmore than 75,000 people globally. The World Health Organization has named the illness COVID-19, referring to its origin late last year and the coronavirus that causes it.
articles.content:
A viral outbreak that began in China has infectedmore than 75,000 people globally. The World Health Organization has named the illness COVID-19, referring to its origin late last year and the coronavirus that causes it.

articles.author: By MARI YAMAGUCHI and FOSTER KLUG Associated Press
articles.title: Passengers begin leaving after ship's virus quarantine ends
articles.description: YOKOHAMA, Japan (AP) — Hundreds of passengers began leaving the Diamond Princess cruise ship Wednesday after the end of a much-criticized, two-week quarantine that failed to stop the spread of a new virus among passengers and crew.
articles.content:
YOKOHAMA, Japan (AP) Hundreds of passengers began leaving the Diamond Princess cruise ship Wednesday after the end of a much-criticized, two-week quarantine that failed to stop the spread of a new virus among passengers and crew.

articles.author: By YANAN WANG Associated Press
articles.title: New virus cases in China fall for 2nd day, deaths top 2,000
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — New virus cases in China continued to fall Wednesday, with 1,749 new infections and 136 new deaths announced after China's leader said disease prevention and control was at a “a critical time.”
